instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - BIOS Lock
threads.message:
Hi, the device is BIOS locked. I don't have proper tools for reprogramming.

What if I change the BIOS from another same model MLB, will that do?

I am okay with the serial number mismatch.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - BIOS Lock
threads.message:
Such change can generate ME region issues.
BIOS file requires clean ME region before place in other board.
Direct change will work, but you can expect to weird issues in time; like reboots, turns off in 5-30min, crash before login macOS, etc...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - BIOS Lock
threads.message:
Can I use this?

If yes, can you help me with this? I didn't find any relevant content.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 - BIOS Lock
threads.message:
You need to remove the SPI chip and read it first.
Verify to get good reading and save a backup in your service PC.

Post the exact 820-xxxx board code you have on the desk.
